name: Toast with Mackerel, Avocado & Lemon
ingredients: 2 thin slices(1 1/2 oz ea) sourdough bread (or gluten free)
125g mackerel in brine or sardines or smoked salmon
preparation: Toast bread until golden brown.
At the same time, mash avocado with half the lemon juice and season with salt and pepper.
Spread mashed avocado over toast and top with mackerel, tomato, arugula, a drizzle of lemon juice and season with cracked black pepper to serve.

name: Peanut Butter Cup Smoothie
ingredients: 1 cup (250ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄3 cup (35g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1⁄4 cup chocolate protein powder or vanilla plus 2 tsp cocoa powder
1 tbs crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
1⁄4 tsp cocoa powder (or cacao powder) for dusting, optional
preparation: Blend all ingredients until smooth and creamy.
Dust with cocoa (if using).

name: Peach & Raspberry Smoothie
ingredients: 3⁄4 cup (190ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄3 cup (40g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
1 yellow peach, medium or white peach (or 110g drained tinned peaches in juice)
preparation: Blend all ingredients on high until smooth and creamy and serve.

name: Oaty Breakfast Bars
ingredients: 2⁄3 cup (150g) almond butter (or other nut butter)
1⁄4 cup maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1 1⁄2 cups (150g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
3⁄4 cup (90g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
preparation: Preheat oven to 320°F and line an 8 inch square cake tin with baking paper.
In a large bowl, combine almond butter, maple syrup, eggs and bananas until smooth.
Stir through oats, almonds, protein powder and baking powder, adding a little water if the mixture is too dry.
Spoon mixture into prepared tin, smooth over the top and bake for 15 minutes.
Cool in tin before cutting into even sized bars.
Store refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 5 days.

name: Maple Coffee Smoothie
ingredients: 1 tsp instant coffee dissolved in 1 fl oz hot water (or 1 fl oz shot espresso)
1 1⁄2 cups (375ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄4 cup (30g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
1⁄2 cup rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
3 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1⁄4 tsp cocoa powder (or cacao powder) for dusting (optional)
preparation: Dissolve coffee in hot water (or use a shot of espresso).
Add to blender with all the other ingredients (except cocoa) and blend on high until smooth and creamy. (You may need to add a little water depending on how thick your protein powder is.)
Transfer to a glass and dust with cocoa to serve.

name: Pan Con Tomate & Chorizo (Spanish Tomato Bread)
ingredients: 100g sourdough baguette (or gluten free) halved horizontally
2 sprigs of fresh basil leaves picked
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F.
Place bread on a baking sheet cut-side up and bake for 5-10 minutes until lightly golden.
Meanwhile, coarsely grate tomatoes into a bowl. Finely chop the skins, stir through tomato and season with salt and pepper.
Place toasted bread on serving plates and spoon over tomato.
Drizzle with oil and stand for 5-10 minutes to absorb.
Top with olives and basil and serve with chorizo on the side.

name: Smoky Paprika Beans with Mushrooms & Feta
ingredients: 1 can of diced tomatoes (14 oz can)
1 can of butter beans (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1 thick slice (2 1/2 oz) wholegrain bread (or gluten free) toasted
preparation: Spray a non-stick skillet with oil, add onion and cook for 4-5 mins to soften.
Add mushrooms and cook for 5 minutes, stirring halfway through, or until mushrooms have browned.
Add paprika and stir through for a minute.
Stir through tomatoes and beans and simmer for 10 minutes to thicken sauce. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Transfer beans to serving plate with toast and top with feta and parsley to serve.

name: Buttermilk Hotcakes with Whipped Cinnamon Almond Butter
ingredients: 1⁄4 cup (30g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
1 tbs almond butter (or other nut butter)
1 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Whisk buttermilk, egg and vanilla together in a bowl.
Add flour, protein powder and baking powder and mix until combined, adding a little water if mixture is too thick.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Working in batches, place heaped spoonfuls of mixture into the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes each side until lightly golden and cooked through.
Whisk together almond butter, maple syrup and cinnamon until light and smooth, adding a little hot water to thin if the mixture is too thick.
Arrange hotcakes on serving plate. Spoon over almond butter and top with raspberries to serve.
**Hack: To make your own buttermilk, mix 2 tsp vinegar or lemon juice with 1⁄2 cup of milk and let stand for 5 minutes.

name: Apple Berry Baked Oatmeal
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (50g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1⁄2 cup (50g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
3⁄4 cup (190ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
preparation: Preheat oven to 320°F.
Combine oats, protein powder, milk, apple sauce and cinnamon in a bowl.
Gently fold through berries.

Transfer mixture to a small-medium size oven proof dish and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until oats are tender. (You may need to add a little more milk if too thick, depending on the protein powder used.)
Can be kept refrigerated for up to 2 days.

name: Protein Powerhouse Parfait
ingredients: 1⁄4 cup (30g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
2 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Whisk yogurt, protein powder and water together in a large bowl to blend. Depending on the protein powder, you may need to add a little more water if too thick.
Transfer to a serving bowl and top with berries, seeds and coconut.
Drizzle over maple syrup to serve.

name: Spicy Sausage Omelette with Mushrooms & Greens
ingredients: 200g spicy lamb sausages (or any other spicy sausage)
2 sprigs of fresh basil leaves picked & torn
2 thin slices (1 1/2 oz ea) wholegrain bread (or gluten free) toasted
preparation: Heat a small non-stick skillet over medium heat. Spray with oil and cook mushrooms for a few minutes to brown.
Add spinach and cook for a minute to wilt. Season with salt and pepper, transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Return skillet to the heat, prick sausages with a fork and add to the skillet. Cook, turning frequently for 10 minutes or until golden and cooked through. Drain on paper towels to absorb excess fat.
Meanwhile, whisk eggs with water and season with salt and pepper.

Heat another small skillet over medium heat and spray with oil. Pour egg mixture over and tilt the skillet to evenly coat the bottom. Cook, gently pushing cooked egg from the outer edge into the center, allowing uncooked egg to run to the outside. Once almost cooked, add mushrooms and spinach to half of the omelette, fold in half and cook for another minute.
Toss leaves with basil and lemon juice and season with salt and pepper.
Divide omelette and sausages between plates and serve with dressed leaves and toast.

name: Sheet Pan Strawberry Pancakes
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (125ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄2 cup (70g) all-purpose flour (or gluten-free if required)
1⁄4 cup (30g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
2 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a small rectangular baking tin with baking paper.
Whisk together banana, milk and egg in a large bowl.
Add flour, protein powder and baking powder and stir to combine.
Pour into prepared tin and scatter over strawberries. Bake for 15 minutes or until lightly golden and cooked through.
Cool for 5 minutes then remove from tin and cut into equal portions.
Divide between serving plates and drizzle with maple syrup to serve.

name: Tortilla Baked Eggs
ingredients: 4 sprigs of fresh cilantro leaves picked (optional)
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and lightly spray 2 large Texas (¾ cup) muffin holes with oil.

Place a non-stick saucepan over medium-high heat. Add bell pepper and onion and cook, stirring, for 5 minutes until soft. Remove from heat, season with salt and pepper and spread on a plate to cool slightly.
Heat tortillas according to packet instructions. Press tortillas into muffin holes, making a cup shape.
Whisk eggs and stir through bell pepper mixture. Divide between each tortilla and top with cheese.
Bake for 12-15 minutes until the eggs are cooked to your liking.
Top with cilantro (if using), season and serve.

name: Cheesy Avocado Toast
ingredients: 2 thin slices (1 1/2 oz ea) wholegrain bread (or gluten free)
preparation: Preheat a broiler to medium heat.
Place cottage and cheddar cheese in a small bowl and mix well to combine. Season with salt and pepper.
Toast bread on one side until lightly golden, turn and toast the other side.
Spread vegemite, or marmite, evenly over toast (if using) and spoon over cheese mixture.
Return toast to broiler and cook for 2 minutes or until golden.
Top with sliced avocado and season with pepper to serve.

name: Perfect Protein Pancakes
ingredients: 1 1⁄2 cups (205g) all-purpose flour (or gluten-free if required)
1⁄4 cup (30g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
1 1⁄2 cups (375ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1 tbs maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: In a large mixing bowl, combine flour, protein powder, baking soda, cinnamon and salt.
In a separate smaller bowl, whisk together eggs and milk.
Add wet ingredients to dry ingredients and stir gently to combine. Mix in mashed banana (not slices) and set aside.

Heat a non-stick skillet over medium-low heat and spray with a little oil. Pour in ⅓ cup of batter per pancake and cook for 3-4 minutes or until bubbles appear on the surface of the pancakes. Flip and cook the other side for 1-2 minutes.
Transfer to a plate, cover with foil and cook the remaining pancakes.
Divide pancakes between plates, top with banana slices, berries and drizzle over maple syrup to serve.

name: Ginger, Apple & Banana Smoothie
ingredients: 1 cup (250ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄3 cup (40g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
1 tbs rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1 tsp fresh ginger chopped or 1/4 tsp ground ginger
preparation: Blend all ingredients in a high speed blender for 1-2 minutes until smooth.
Transfer to a glass to serve.

name: Avocado & Fava Bean Toast
ingredients: 2 thick slices (2 1/2 oz ea) wholegrain bread (or gluten free) toasted
2 tsp dukkah (a mix of chopped almonds, sesame seeds & ground cumin)
preparation: Place fava beans in a small heatproof bowl and cover with boiling water. Allow to stand for 5 minutes then peel, discarding skins.
Place avocado, tofu and lemon juice in a small bowl and roughly mash together so it’s still chunky.
Mix through fava beans and season with salt and pepper.
Spread toast with avocado mixture and scatter over dukkah and lemon zest to serve.

name: Almond & Blueberry Breakfast Muffins
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (125ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
2 tbs maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
2⁄3 cup (80g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
preparation: Preheat oven to 320°F and line 6 large muffin holes with paper cases.
Combine milk, maple syrup, eggs and banana in a bowl.
Add almond meal, protein powder and baking powder and mix well to combine.
Fold through blueberries and half the almonds.
Divide mixture between muffin cases and scatter over remaining almonds.

Bake for 25 minutes until cooked in the center. Transfer to a wire rack to cool.
Store remaining in an airtight container for up to 3 days or freeze for up to 3 months.

name: Chia Berry Parfait
ingredients: 2⁄3 cup (160ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄4 cup (30g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
preparation: Combine milk, protein powder, chia, banana, dates and salt in a bowl and set aside for at least 4 hours, or overnight, stirring once to evenly distribute the chia.
At the same time in a small saucepan, simmer blueberries with a dash of water over medium heat for at least 5 minutes to breakdown and thicken to a sauce consistency. Place in the fridge to cool.
When ready to serve, layer blueberry compote and chia mixture into a small jar or glass. Top with granola and fresh berries to serve.

name: Blueberry & Kale Reset Smoothie
ingredients: 1 1⁄4 cups (315ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄3 cup (40g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
2 tbs rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1 tbs crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
1 medium banana sliced & frozen in advance
preparation: Blend all ingredients in a high-powered blender on high for 1-2 minutes or until smooth.

name: One-Skillet Breakfast Tacos
ingredients: 1 can of kidney beans (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1 sprig of rosemary leaves picked & finely chopped
4 small (1 ½ oz ea) wholegrain/wholewheat wraps or tortillas (or gluten free)
preparation: Heat oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat and sauté onion and garlic for 4-5 minutes or until golden.
Stir in mushrooms and continue to cook for another 5 minutes to soften.
Stir through beans, tomatoes (if using), spices, rosemary and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Create 4 holes in the mixture and crack an egg into each. Cover the skillet with a lid and cook for 3-4 minutes or until eggs are done to your liking.
At the same time, heat tortillas in a dry skillet or hot oven for a few minutes.
Divide beans and eggs between warm tortillas and scatter over parsley to serve.

name: Gingerbread Smoothie
ingredients: 1 cup (250ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄3 cup (40g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
1⁄3 cup rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
2 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Blend all ingredients in a blender until smooth and creamy.
Transfer to a glass and dust with extra ground cinnamon to serve.

name: Raspberry Oatmeal with Ricotta & Honey
ingredients: 1 cup (250ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄4 cup (30g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
1⁄2 cup (50g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
2 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Whisk milk and protein powder to combine, adding extra water if necessary.
Combine with oats in a medium saucepan. Bring to a gentle boil and lower to simmer, whilst stirring constantly.
Add orange juice and half the raspberries and continue to cook for 8-10 minutes, stirring gently every 3 minutes, until creamy.
Transfer to serving bowl and top with the remaining raspberries, ricotta, honey and orange zest to serve.

name: Chocolate, Cherry & Coconut Smoothie Bowl
ingredients: 1⁄3 cup Greek yogurt (or dairy-free alternative) frozen
1⁄3 cup milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄4 cup (25g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1⁄4 cup chocolate protein powder or vanilla or natural protein powder plus 2 tbs cocoa powder
2 tsp 70% dark chocolate (or dairy-free alternative) chopped
preparation: Place banana, yogurt, milk, oats, protein powder and cinnamon in a blender and process on high until smooth, thick and creamy.
Transfer to a bowl and top with cherries, chocolate and coconut to serve.

name: Goat’s Cheese, Spinach & Mushroom Scrambled Eggs
ingredients: 2 thin slices (1 1/2 oz ea) wholegrain bread (or gluten free) toasted
preparation: Whisk eggs together in a small bowl until you have even color and texture.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium low heat.
Spray sliced mushrooms with oil, season with salt and pepper and add to hot skillet. Sauté for 3-4 minutes or until golden brown.
Add spinach to the skillet of mushrooms and stir for 30 seconds to wilt.
Add egg mixture and continue to stir, keeping your spatula moving the entire time to create large curds.
Season to taste with salt and pepper and transfer to serving plate.
Crumble over goat’s cheese, season with cayenne and serve with toast.

name: Carrot Cake Overnight Oats
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (125ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄3 cup (30g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1⁄3 cup (40g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
1 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Place dates in a small bowl and cover with boiling water. Set aside for 10 minutes to soften.
Drain dates and blend with milk, oats, protein powder, spice and carrot in a blender until almost smooth but still with a bit of texture.
Transfer to a serving glass, cover and refrigerate for 2 hours or overnight.
To serve, top with yogurt, walnuts and drizzle over maple syrup.

name: Smashed Chickpea, Feta & Tomato Toast
ingredients: 1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
2 thin slices (1 1/2 oz ea) rye bread (or gluten free) toasted
2 sprigs of parsley leaves picked & roughly chopped
2 tsp dukkah (a mix of chopped almonds, sesame seeds & ground cumin)
preparation: Mash chickpeas and lemon juice in a bowl and season with salt and pepper.
Spread chickpea mash on toast, add tomatoes and crumble over feta.
Scatter over parsley and dukkah and season with salt and pepper to serve.

name: Chocolate Nut & Seed Protein Oats with Caramelized Banana
ingredients: 1 1⁄2 cups (150g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
2 1⁄2 tbs cocoa powder (or cacao powder) plus extra to dust
3 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Toast oats and half the pepitas and sunflower kernels in a small saucepan over low heat for 2 minutes.
Add cocoa powder and stir to coat.
Stir through milk, water and protein powder. Bring to the boil, reduce to a simmer and cook for 5 minutes, whisking constantly. Adding more water if necessary.
Add honey and mix well.
At the same time, heat a small non-stick skillet set over med-high heat. Add banana pieces and cook for a minute each side or until golden brown.
Divide oats between bowls and top with cooked banana, remaining seeds and hazelnuts. Dust with extra cocoa powder to serve.

name: Brussels Sprouts Hash with Poached Eggs
ingredients: 2 thin slices(1 1/2 oz ea) sourdough bread (or gluten free) torn into pieces
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F .
Place sourdough onto a baking sheet and bake for 8-10 minutes until golden and crunchy. Set aside.
Meanwhile, heat a medium non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add onion and bacon and cook, stirring, for 8-10 minutes until onion is caramelized and bacon is crisp.
Add garlic and cook for a minute until fragrant.
Add brussels sprouts and cook, stirring, for 5-7 minutes until wilted. Add sauerkraut and season with salt and pepper.

At the same time, bring a small saucepan of water to the boil, reduce to a gentle simmer and add vinegar. Stir in a circular motion to create a vortex and gently slide eggs into water. Cook for 3 minutes for soft yolk or to your liking. Remove with a slotted spoon, gently pat dry and season with salt and pepper.
Transfer hash to a serving plate and top with eggs and sourdough croutons to serve.

name: Granola Breakfast Bar
ingredients: 1⁄4 cup (75g) honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
1 cup (100g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
preparation: Preheat oven to 250°F and line an 8 inch square baking tin with baking paper.
Place honey in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a simmer and cook, without stirring, for 2-3 minutes until honey bubbles and begins to caramelize around the edge of the saucepan.

Remove from heat and immediately add coconut oil, almonds, pepitas, oats and cranberries. Mix well to coat and transfer to prepared tin, pressing down firmly. Bake for 30 minutes then cool completely in tin.

For topping, place coconut oil and water in a saucepan over medium heat until oil has melted. Whisk in protein powder until smooth. Not all protein powders are created equal so you may need to add a little more hot water.
Spread over slice and sprinkle with coconut. Refrigerate, overnight if possible, to set.
Using a large serrated or cook's knife, gently 'saw' into 5 even bars  Store refrigerated in an airtight container for a week or freeze for up to 3 months.

name: Elvis Granola
ingredients: 1⁄3 cup (100g) crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
1⁄4 cup (60ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
2 cups (200g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1 cup (250g) Greek yogurt (or dairy-free alternative) 1/4 cup per serve
preparation: Preheat oven to 320°F and line a shallow baking dish with baking paper.
Blend peanut butter, maple syrup, oil and banana until smooth.
In a large bowl combine oats, walnuts, almonds and salt.
Add wet mixture to dry and mix well.
Spread over prepared dish and bake, tossing 2-3 times during cooking, for 20-25 minutes or until slightly golden.
Allow to cool, before breaking up into smaller clusters and storing in an airtight container.
Serve granola with yogurt.

name: Creamy Cantaloupe Smoothie
ingredients: 1 cup (250ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄3 cup (40g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
1⁄3 cup (30g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
preparation: Blend all ingredients on high until smooth and creamy.

name: Turkish-Style Breakfast
ingredients: lemon half juiced & half cut in wedges
3 thick slices (2 1/2 oz ea) sourdough bread (or gluten free) toasted
preparation: Place eggs in a saucepan of cold water and bring to the boil. Continue to simmer for 5  minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon and place in a sink of cold water to cool. Peel and cut in half.
Place cucumber, tomato, parsley and lemon juice in a small bowl. Season with salt and pepper and toss to combine.
Arrange eggs, salad, hummus, olives and toast on a serving plate or platter, scatter over zaatar and serve with lemon wedges.

name: Banana, PB & Cinnamon Toast
ingredients: 2 tbs vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
1 1⁄2 tbs crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
2 thin slices (1 1/2 oz ea) rye bread (or gluten free) toasted
1⁄4 tsp ground cinnamon 1/8 -1/4 tsp depending on taste
preparation: Combine protein powder, water and peanut butter in a small bowl.
Spread mixture evenly over toast and top with banana.
Dust with cinnamon and scatter over sunflower kernels to serve.

name: Peanut Butter, Banana & Blueberry Oats
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (50g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
2 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1 tbs crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
preparation: Place oats, milk and water in a saucepan and bring to a gentle simmer.
Add banana, cinnamon and a pinch of salt and stir to combine. Continue stirring until thick and creamy and remove from heat.
At the same time, make jam by adding all ingredients to a saucepan. Cook, stirring frequently, until thick and jammy.
To serve, place oats in bowl and top with blueberry jam, maple syrup, walnuts and peanut butter. Enjoy!

name: Corn & Jalapeño Fritters with Poached Eggs
ingredients: 2 tbs all-purpose flour (or gluten-free if required)
1 jalapeno chilli pepper finely chopped, plus extra to serve
preparation: To make fritters, place corn and egg into a small food processor and pulse until almost smooth, but with a few whole kernels. Transfer to a bowl.
Add flour, baking powder, jalapeno, season with salt and pepper and mix to combine.
Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Spoon even-sized fritters into the skillet and cook for 3-4 minutes each side until golden and cooked through. Transfer to a plate and keep warm.
Add spinach to skillet and cook for a few minutes until wilted. Set aside.

Meanwhile, bring a medium saucepan of water to the boil, reduce to a gentle simmer and add vinegar. Stir in a circular motion to create a vortex and separately slide eggs into water and cook to your liking. Remove with a slotted spoon and pat dry with paper towel.
Arrange spinach and fritters on a plate and top with poached eggs and extra jalapeno. Season with salt and pepper to serve.

name: Carrot Cake Pancakes
ingredients: 2 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
2⁄3 cup (160ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄3 cup (40g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
1⁄3 cup (45g) wholewheat spelt flour (or gluten free)
preparation: To make pancakes, whisk together milk and egg in a large bowl. Add carrot, protein powder, flour, cinnamon and baking powder and mix until combined.
Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat.

Use a 1⁄4 cup measure to pour pancakes into skillet. Cook for 2 minutes or until bubbles appear and pancake looks set. Flip and cook for another minute. Set aside in a warm place and repeat with remaining mixture.
Transfer pancakes to a serving plate and top with yogurt, honey and walnuts to serve.

name: Veggie Waffle Breakfast Burger
preparation: Preheat a waffle iron, or alternatively this mix can also be made into pancakes.

To make waffles, place zucchini, carrot and salt in a bowl and toss to combine. Transfer to a colander over a bowl and allow to stand for 10 minutes to draw out water. Use your hands to squeeze out as much liquid out of the vegetables as possible. Transfer to a large bowl.

Add remaining waffle ingredients, season well and mix to combine. Spoon a quarter of the mixture into the waffle iron and cook for 4-5 minutes until golden. Repeat with remaining mixture to make four waffles.
Meanwhile, heat a medium non-stick skillet over medium heat and cook bacon for 2 minutes each side. In the same skillet, crack in eggs and cook for 2 minutes, or until cooked to your liking.
To serve, spread avocado over half the waffle burger bases, followed by lettuce, tomato, bacon and eggs. Season and sandwich with remaining waffles to serve.

name: Ham & Cheese Crepe
ingredients: 1⁄3 cup (80ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
preparation: Place flour, milk and egg in a small bowl and whisk to combine. Season with salt and pepper and set aside.

Heat a medium non-stick skillet over medium heat. Pour in half the batter and swirl pan to coat evenly. Cook for 2 minutes until set around the edges. Flip and cook for a further 1-2 minutes. Transfer to a plate and repeat with remaining batter.
To assemble, spread half of each crepe with mustard, top with ham and cheese and fold into quarters.
Reheat skillet again over medium heat. Add crepes and cook for 1-2 minutes, turning once, until heated through and cheese begins to melt. Transfer to a plate and serve with arugula.

name: Okonomiyaki (Japanese Pancakes)
preparation: Whisk flour, baking powder, cottage cheese, egg and stock together until smooth.
Add carrot and cabbage to the batter, season with salt and pepper and mix well to combine.

Heat oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Form mixture into a large pancake and cook for 3 minutes, or until golden on the bottom, flip and cook for a further 2-3 minutes until golden and cooked through.
Transfer pancake to serving plate, drizzle over mayonnaise and barbecue sauce and scatter over scallions to serve.

name: Fried Egg Banh Mi
ingredients: 1⁄2 Lebanese cucumber peeled into thin ribbons
preparation: To make the mayo, place all ingredients in a small food processor and blend until smooth. Set aside.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and cook eggs for 2 minutes, or until cooked to your liking. Remove from heat and season with salt and pepper.
To assemble, cut baguette in half horizontally and spread mayo on the base. Toss carrot with vinegar and add to baguette. Top with cucumber, chilli, fried eggs and cilantro to serve.

name: Red Velvet Pancakes
ingredients: 1⁄4 cup (65ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1 tbs maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: To make pancakes, place beets, milk, eggs, maple syrup and vanilla in a small food processor and blend until smooth.
Add flour, cocoa and baking powder and pulse until combined.
Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Working in batches, spoon 6 even-sized pancakes into pan. Cook for 2 minutes each side until cooked through.
Melt chocolate in microwave in 30 second bursts until smooth. Alternately, place chocolate in a glass bowl over a saucepan of simmering water and melt until smooth.
Divide pancakes between plates, drizzle with melted chocolate and top with raspberries to serve.

name: Mango & Green Tea Smoothie
ingredients: 1 cup (250ml) water boiled and left to stand for a few minutes to cool slightly
4 tbs (40g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
3 tbs rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
preparation: Add tea bag to slightly cooled water and let stand for a few minutes to brew. Remove tea bag and place brewed tea in the freezer for 10 minutes to chill.
Place cooled tea and remaining ingredients in a blender and blend on high until smooth and creamy.

name: PB & Raspberry Pancakes
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (125ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄2 cup (70g) wholewheat spelt flour (or gluten free)
2 tbs vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
2 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
2 tsp crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
preparation: Blend milk, flour, protein powder, baking powder, egg, banana and honey until smooth.

Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Working in batches, use roughly a 1⁄4 cup measure to pour 3 pancakes into the skillet and cook for 2 minutes until bubbles appear on top. Flip and cook for a further minute. Remove from skillet and repeat with remaining mixture.
At the same time, place half the raspberries in a small bowl, mash with a fork.
Microwave peanut butter in a small bowl on high for 20 seconds until soft.
Serve pancakes topped with peanut butter, berry sauce and remaining berries.

name: Coconut, Blueberry & Date Smoothie
ingredients: 2 tbs vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
preparation: Combine all ingredients in a blender until smooth. Enjoy!

name: Cherry Berry Smoothie
ingredients: 1⁄3 cup (40g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
1⁄4 cup rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1 cup (250ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
preparation: Blend all ingredients, except grated chocolate, until smooth and creamy.
Pour into a glass and top with shaved chocolate to serve.

name: Gingerbread Overnight Oats
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (50g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1⁄3 cup (40g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
1⁄2 tsp pumpkin pie spice plus extra to serve
3⁄4 cup (190ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Place oats, protein powder, spices, milk, maple syrup and vanilla in a bowl and stir to combine. Cover with cling wrap and refrigerate for 15 minutes (or overnight). Add a litlle extra milk if too thick.
To serve, transfer to serving bowl, top with banana slices, pecans and dust with extra mixed spice.

name: Vegetarian Breakfast Frittatas
ingredients: 1 cup (180g) frozen broad beans defrosted & peeled
1⁄2 bunch of fresh mint (3 oz bunch) leaves picked & chopped
preparation: Preheat oven to 320°F and grease 6 holes of a standard 12-hole muffin tin.
Heat oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Cook onion for 4-5 minutes until soft. Add garlic and spinach and toss for 1 minute until wilted. Set aside to cool.
Whisk eggs and parmesan together and season with salt and pepper. Stir through quinoa, feta, fava beans, mint and spinach mixture.
Divide mixture between the prepared muffin holes and bake for 25 minutes until golden. Cool muffins in the tin for 5 minutes before removing.
Cool completely and store covered and refrigerated for up to 3 days or frozen for 1 month.

name: Pumpkin Spice Smoothie
ingredients: 1 1⁄2 cups (375ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
150g canned pumpkin puree (unsweetened) or 4 oz pumpkin steamed & mashed
3 tbs (30g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1⁄3 cup (40g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
2 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1 tsp pumpkin pie spice plus extra to dust
preparation: Blend all ingredients in a blender on high until smooth. Serve dusted with extra mixed spice.

name: Cinnamon Peach Smoothie
ingredients: 1 1⁄2 cups (375ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1 yellow peach, medium cut in slices, reserving one to serve
1⁄4 cup (30g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
2 tbs (20g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1⁄2 tsp ground cinnamon plus extra for dusting
preparation: Blend all ingredients, except one peach slice, in a blender on high until smooth and creamy.
Pour into glass, add peach slice and dust with extra cinnamon to serve.

name: Breakfast Burrito
ingredients: 4 sprigs of fresh cilantro finely chopped
2 small (1 ½ oz ea) wholegrain/wholewheat wraps or tortillas (or gluten free)
preparation: Whisk eggs and cilantro in a bowl, season with salt and pepper and set aside.
Heat a small non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add bell pepper and cook for 8 minutes, stirring occasionally until softened.

Pour egg mixture over and tilt the skillet to evenly coat the bottom. Cook, gently pushing cooked egg from the outer edge into the centre, allowing uncooked egg to run to the outside. Once almost cooked, flip over and cook for a further minute. Remove omelette from skillet, cut in half and set aside.
Arrange spinach leaves over wraps to cover. Add omelette and scatter over tomato and cheese.
Season, roll up and cut in half to serve.

name: French Toast with Banana & Hazelnuts
ingredients: 1 cup (250ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
2 thin slices (1 1/2 oz ea) wholegrain bread (or gluten free)
2 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Whisk flaxseed meal, milk and cinnamon in a large bowl and set aside for 10 minutes to thicken.
Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Dip bread into thickened milk and allow to soak for 10-15 seconds on each side. Wipe off excess mixture, transfer to skillet and cook for 3 minutes each side, until golden.
Top with yogurt, banana and hazelnuts and drizzle over maple syrup to serve.

name: Smoky Mushrooms & Tofu
preparation: Wrap tofu in paper towel and press under a weight (eg.cans of beans on a board) to remove water. Cut into small cubes.
Heat a large non-stick skillet over high heat. Add mushrooms and cook for 3-4 minutes until golden. Transfer to a plate.
Add tofu to skillet and allow to cook for a few minutes before turning. Continue to cook for 5 minutes or until golden. Sprinkle over paprika and toss to coat.
Toss quinoa, tomatoes, mung beans, mushrooms and tofu together to combine.
Transfer to a serving plate, top with avocado, squeeze over lemon, season with salt and pepper and serve.

name: Chai-Spiced Oatmeal
ingredients: 1 cup (100g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
3⁄4 cup (190ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1 medium banana half mashed & half sliced
2 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: To make Chai Spice Blend, mix all ingredients in a small bowl and set aside.
For the oatmeal, place oats, chia seeds and water in a medium saucepan. Bring to the boil, then reduce to a gentle simmer.
Add milk and half the Chai Spice Blend and stir constantly for 6-7 minutes or until oats have thickened and cooked through.
Remove from heat and stir through mashed banana.
Serve topped with maple syrup, sliced banana and a dusting of extra spice mix.

name: Choc Banana Protein Oatmeal
ingredients: 3⁄4 cup (75g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1⁄2 cup (125ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄4 cup (30g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
1 tbs cocoa powder (or cacao powder) plus extra for dusting
2 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1 medium banana half mashed & half sliced
preparation: Add oats, water and salt to a saucepan. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a gentle simmer.
Add milk and stir constantly for 6-7 minutes or until oats have thickened and cooked through.
Remove from heat and stir through protein powder, cocoa, maple syrup, vanilla and mashed banana.
Serve topped with sliced banana and a dusting of cocoa.

name: Smashed Pea & Fava Bean Toast
ingredients: 3⁄4 cup (135g) frozen broad beans defrosted & podded
3 thick slices (2 1/2 oz ea) wholegrain bread (or gluten free) toasted
1 1⁄2 tsp dukkah (a mix of chopped almonds, sesame seeds & ground cumin)
1 sprig of fresh mint leaves picked & chopped
preparation: Cook peas and fava beans in a saucepan of salted boiling water for 2-3 minutes until just tender. Drain and spread on a plate to cool.
Add to a food processor with nutritional yeast and water and pulse until coarsely mashed. Season with salt and pepper.
Spread on toast, scatter over dukkah, chilli and mint to serve.

Note: Podding frozen fava beans is required to remove the tough skin that covers each individual bean. You can speed up the thawing process by pouring boiling water over fava beans. Drain beans and allow to cool, use your nail to pierce the skin, then pop out the bright green bean.

name: Banana & Raspberry Overnight Oats
ingredients: 2 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
3 tbs rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
preparation: Blend yogurt, cottage cheese, honey and vanilla until smooth.
Add oats and half the coconut to yogurt mixture and stir together. Refrigerate for 15 minutes (or overnight).
Place half the oat mixture into a small jar, add banana and half the raspberries. Add remaining oat mixture and top with remaining raspberries and coconut to serve.

name: Mango Passionfruit Smoothie Bowl
ingredients: 2 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Blend milk, yogurt, protein, mango, banana and honey in a blender until smooth and creamy.
Transfer to serving bowl and top with granola, blueberries and passionfruit to serve.

name: Breakfast Congee with Bacon
ingredients: 2 scallions thinly sliced, plus extra to serve
60g asparagus thinly sliced on the angle
1⁄4 bunch of fresh flat leaf parsley (5 oz bunch) chopped
1 tsp soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
preparation: In a medium saucepan add stock, rice, ginger and half the scallions and bring to the boil. Reduce to a simmer and cook for 30 minutes or until rice is cooked.
Heat a non-stick skillet and cook bacon for 5 minutes. Remove bacon from skillet, add remaining scallions and asparagus and cook for 5 minutes.
To make dressing, blend all ingredients in a food processor until smooth, adjust seasoning and set aside.
Transfer rice to serving bowl and top with bacon mix. Drizzle over dressing to serve.

name: Spiced Rhubarb Compote with Granola
ingredients: 2 tbs (40ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Combine rhubarb, water, maple syrup, cinnamon and cardamom in a small saucepan. Simmer over medium heat for 5-7 minutes until rhubarb is tender. Discard cinnamon stick and cool to room temperature.
Blend cottage cheese and yogurt together until smooth and divide between bowls. Spoon over compote and swirl together. Sprinkle over granola and almonds to serve.

name: Coconut & Cacao Granola
ingredients: 2 tbs maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1 tbs raw cacao powder (or cocoa powder)
1⁄2 cup (60g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
2 tbs water adding more if needed to blend
preparation: Preheat oven to 280°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.

Place maple syrup, cacao, coconut oil and cinnamon in a large bowl and whisk to combine. Add puffed rice, coconut flakes, almonds, pepitas and buckwheat and mix to coat evenly. Spread mixture onto baking sheet and bake for 25 minutes, stirring occasionally to break up, until lightly golden and crunchy. Set aside to cool.
Combine yogurt and protein powder in a small bowl. Add sufficient water to blend to a smooth consistency.
Divide yogurt between bowls and top with granola and blueberries.
Store granola in an airtight container at room temperature for 1 month.

name: Pumpkin Pie Oatmeal
ingredients: 160g butternut squash grated, or canned pumpkin
1⁄2 cup (50g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
2 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1⁄2 tsp pumpkin pie spice plus extra for dusting
2 tbs (20g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
1 tbs water adding up to 3 tbs to blend
preparation: Place butternut squash, milk, oats, maple syrup and spice in a small saucepan over medium heat. Simmer for 8-10 minutes until thickened and the squash is soft. Pour into serving bowl.
Combine yogurt and protein powder in a small bowl. Add sufficient water to blend to a smooth consistency.
Serve oatmeal topped with yogurt, pecans and a dusting of spice to serve.

name: Granola Yogurt Parfait
ingredients: 2 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1⁄4 cup (30g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
1 tbs water adding up to 3 tbs to blend
1 sprig of fresh mint small leaves picked
preparation: Place maple syrup and nuts in a small skillet and cook over low heat for 3 minutes or until sticky. Allow to cool.
Combine yogurt and protein powder in a small bowl. Add sufficient water to blend to a smooth consistency.
Layer half the fruit, yogurt and granola into a glass, then repeat layers again with the other half of the ingredients.
Scatter over maple-nuts, dust with cinnamon and top with mint leaves to serve.

name: Salted Caramel Oatmeal
ingredients: 1 cup (100g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
30g pitted dates soaked in hot water for at least 30 minutes
preparation: For the date syrup, blend drained dates (reserve soaking liquid), coconut milk and salt in a high speed blender until smooth & combined. Add sufficient date soaking liquid to form a syrup.
Heat a medium saucepan over medium heat, add walnuts and toast for 2-3 minutes, shaking saucepan frequently until nuts are golden and aromatic. Set aside.

Add oats, cinnamon, salt and water to the saucepan. Bring to the boil, then reduce to a gentle simmer. Add milk and stir constantly for 6-7 minutes until oats are thickened and cooked through. Remove from heat and stir through half the date syrup.
Divide oatmeal between bowls, drizzle over remaining date syrup and top with toasted walnuts and a pinch of salt to serve.

name: Raspberry & Black Sesame Porridge
ingredients: 1⁄4 cup (45g) steel cut oats (or quinoa if gluten free)
2 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1⁄3 cup (45g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
preparation: Bring water and salt to the boil in a medium saucepan. Add oats, tahini, cinnamon and half the maple syrup and simmer, stirring regularly for 15-20 minutes or until the porridge is soft and creamy. Stir through protein powder and hemp seeds, adding a little water if neccessary.
Spoon porridge into serving bowl, top with milk, raspberries and sesame seeds and drizzle over remaining maple syrup.

name: Ricotta & Fruit Toast
ingredients: 3 tbs (30g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
2 thin slices (1 1/2 oz ea) wholegrain bread (or gluten free)
2 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Mix ricotta and protein powder until smooth, adding a little water if too thick.
Toast bread and spread with ricotta mixture.
Top with pear, drizzle with honey and scatter over walnuts to serve.

name: Eggs & Asparagus with Sourdough Toast
ingredients: 3 thin slices (1 1/2 oz ea) wholegrain bread (or gluten free) toasted
2 tsp dukkah (a mix of chopped almonds, sesame seeds & ground cumin)
preparation: Heat a non-stick griddle pan over medium-high heat. Toss asparagus with oil and season with salt and pepper. Grill for 5 minutes, turning, until charred and tender.
Place eggs in a saucepan of cold water and bring to a rolling boil. Continue to simmer for 5  minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon and place in a sink of cold water to cool. Peel and cut in half.
Spread toast with cottage cheese and top with asparagus and eggs. Scatter over dukkah and season with salt and pepper to serve.

name: Tahini, Honey & Banana Toast
ingredients: 2 tsp hulled tahini at room temperature
2 thin slices (1 1/2 oz ea) wholegrain bread (or gluten free) toasted
1 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Place cottage cheese and tahini in a small food processor and blend until smooth.
Spread over toast and top with banana, honey and peanuts.

name: Tropical Smoothie
ingredients: 1 cup (250ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄3 cup (35g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1⁄4 cup (30g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
2 sprigs of fresh mint leaves picked
preparation: Blend all ingredients on high until smooth and creamy and serve.

name: Almond & Blueberry Smoothie
ingredients: 1⁄4 cup (30g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
2 tbs rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1 1⁄2 tbs almond butter (or other nut butter)
preparation: Blend all ingredients on high until smooth and creamy and serve.

name: Vegan Banana & Peanut Butter Smoothie
ingredients: 2 tbs (20g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
2 tbs (40g) crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
1 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Blend all ingredients until smooth. Enjoy!

name: Smoked Salmon, Dill & Goat’s Cheese on Pumpernickel
preparation: In a small bowl combine goat’s and cottage cheese and season with salt and pepper.
Spread cheese on toasted pumpernickel and add salmon. Top with dill, season with black pepper and serve with lemon wedges.

name: Caramelized Banana Oatmeal with Peanuts
ingredients: 1 medium banana cut in half lengthways
1⁄3 cup rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
2 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1⁄3 cup (40g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
preparation: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add bananas and cook cut-side-down for 1-2 minutes each side until caramelized. Transfer to a plate and set aside.

At the same time combine milk, water, oats, maple syrup and cinnamon in a small saucepan over medium heat. Simmer for 3-4 minutes, stirring, until oats are tender. Stir through protein powder, adding a little extra water if too thick.
Blend tahini with hot water until smooth.
Transfer oats to a serving bowl and top with yogurt and bananas. Drizzle with blended tahini and scatter over peanuts and sesame seeds to serve.

name: Cranberry Spice Smoothie
ingredients: 1 1⁄4 cups (315ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄3 cup (40g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
1⁄3 cup rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
2 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Place all ingredients in a blender and process until smooth and serve.

name: Salted Caramel Date Smoothie
ingredients: 3⁄4 cup (190ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄4 cup (30g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
1⁄3 cup rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
preparation: Blend all ingredients in a blender until smooth. Enjoy!

name: Mexican Black Beans on Toast
ingredients: 1⁄4 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) chopped
1 can of black beans (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
2 thin slices(1 1/2 oz ea) sourdough bread (or gluten free) toasted
preparation: Toss tomatoes, onion, cilantro, lemon juice and salt and pepper in a small bowl and set aside.

Heat oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant. Add beans and sauté for 5 minutes until heated through. Stir cumin and paprika through and roughly mash together.
Spread bean mixture on toast and top with tomato salsa to serve.

name: Spiced Chia Pudding with Raspberries & Pistachio
ingredients: 3 tbs (30g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
2 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Whisk together the chia seeds, orange juice, almond milk, protein powder, cinnamon and cardamom until combined. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes, or overnight.
Place raspberries in a small non-stick saucepan over medium heat and cook for 2 minutes until raspberries release their juices and begin to collapse. Remove from heat.

Mix the chia mixture well to loosen and transfer to a serving glass. Fold raspberries through to create a ripple effect. Top with yogurt and pistachios, drizzle with honey and scatter over reserved orange zest to serve.

name: Zucchini, Pea & Mint Fritters with Feta
ingredients: 4 sprigs of fresh mint shredded, plus extra to garnish
1⁄3 cup (45g) all-purpose flour (or gluten-free if required)
4 thin slices(1 1/2 oz ea) sourdough bread (or gluten free) toasted
preparation: Place zucchini in a clean tea towel and squeeze out as much liquid as possible, then transfer to a large bowl and stir through beaten eggs.
Add spinach, peas, feta, onion, mint, season with salt and pepper and mix to combine. Add flour and baking powder and mix until just combined.
Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat and divide the mixture into four. Add to pan and cook for 3-4 minutes each side until golden and cooked through.
Divide fritters between plates and top with yogurt and extra fresh mint and serve with toast.

name: Coconut Mocha Smoothie
ingredients: 1⁄3 cup (30g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1⁄3 cup (40g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
1 tsp instant coffee dissolved in 1 tbs hot water
preparation: Place all ingredients except coconut flakes in a blender and blend on high until smooth and creamy. Serve topped with coconut flakes.

name: Apple Pie Porridge
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (50g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
2 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Combine milk, oats, maple syrup, cinnamon and apple in a small saucepan over medium heat. Simmer for 8 minutes until thickened and the apples are just tender. Pour into serving bowl.
At the same time, mix cottage cheese, yogurt and vanilla in a small bowl until well combined. Spoon over porridge and top with granola to serve.

name: Buckwheat Savory Crepes with Greens
ingredients: 1 can of cannellini beans (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
preparation: Sift flour and salt into a bowl. Whisk eggs and milk together, add to the dry ingredients and whisk until smooth. Transfer to a jug and set aside.

To make the filling, heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add scallions and cook for 3 minutes or until soft. Add peas, zucchini, beans, dill, lemon zest and juice and cook for 5 minutes, or until warmed through. Adjust seasoning.

Heat a little oil in a crepe pan or small non stick skillet, add enough batter to thinly cover the base and pour any remaining batter back into the jug. Cook for 1 minute or until set, turn over and cook the other side. Remove and keep warm whilst you cook the remaining crepes.
Divide cottage cheese between crepes placing on half of the crepe.
Top with filling, fold over to enclose and serve.

name: Hash Browns with Green Goddess Dressing
ingredients: 1⁄2 bunch of rainbow chard (1 1/2 lb bunch) stalks chopped & leaves shredded
1⁄2 bunch of fresh flat leaf parsley (5 oz bunch) stalks & leaves roughly chopped
preparation: To make the dressing, place all ingredients in a small food processor and blend until smooth and combined. Season with salt and pepper and set aside.
Place sweet potato, rainbow chard, butter, cornstarch and one egg in a large bowl and season with salt and pepper. Mix well to combine and form into hash browns.
Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Cook hash browns, pressing down with a spatula, for 2 minutes each side until golden and cooked through. Transfer to a plate and keep warm.
Crack remaining eggs into skillet and cook for 2 minutes, or until cooked to your liking and season with salt and pepper.
Drizzle hash browns with dressing and top with fried eggs to serve.

name: Essentials Breakfast Board
ingredients: 4 thin slices (1 1/2 oz ea) rye bread (or gluten free) toasted
preparation: Place eggs in a saucepan of cold water and bring to the boil. Continue to simmer for 5  minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon and place in a sink of cold water to cool. Peel and cut in half.
Arrange eggs, avocado, feta, pickles, yogurt, fruit and toast on a board or platter to serve.

name: Sautéed Mushrooms, Garlic & Chilli Toast
ingredients: 2 thick slices (2 1/2 oz ea) rye bread (or gluten free) toasted
1 sprig of fresh basil leaves picked
preparation: Heat oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Cook mushrooms, stirring only after 3 minutes, for 4-5 minutes until golden. Add garlic and chilli, toss with mushrooms for cook for another minute. Season with salt and pepper.
Spread toast with cottage cheese, top with mushroom mixture and scatter over basil leaves to serve.

name: Chocolate Banana Pancakes
ingredients: 2 tbs Greek yogurt (or dairy-free alternative) to serve
2 tbs cocoa powder (or cacao powder) plus extra for dusting
2⁄3 cup (80g) wholewheat spelt flour (or gluten free) or buckwheat for gluten-free
1⁄3 cup (40g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
preparation: Blend pancake ingredients until smooth. (Depending on the protein powder you use, you may need to add a little more milk.)

Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Working in batches, use a 1⁄4 cup measure to pour pancakes and cook for 2 minutes until bubbles appear on top, flip and cook for a further minute. Remove from pan and repeat with remaining mixture.
Top pancakes with yogurt and sliced banana and lightly dust with extra cocoa powder.

name: Oat, Maple & Coconut Smoothie
ingredients: 2 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1⁄3 cup (40g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
3 tbs rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
preparation: Blend all ingredients in a blender on high until smooth.
Pour into glass and enjoy! Top with a sprinkle of coconut if desired.

name: Roasted Veggie Stack with Halloumi & Eggs
ingredients: 800g sweet potatoes cut into 1/2 inch thick rounds
2 zucchini (medium) cut into 1/2 inch thick rounds
1 red bell pepper cut into quarters
4 sprigs of fresh basil leaves picked
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.

Place sweet potato, zucchini and bell pepper on prepared sheet, rub with oil and spread vegetables into a single layer. Season with salt and pepper and roast for 15 minutes. Add the halloumi slices and cook for a further 4-5 minutes until halloumi is lightly golden and vegetables are tender.

Meanwhile, bring a small saucepan of water to the boil, reduce to a gentle simmer and add vinegar. Stir in a circular motion to create a vortex and gently slide eggs into the water and cook for 3 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon, pat dry and season with salt.
Layer vegetables and halloumi on each plate, top with eggs, season and scatter over basil leaves to serve.

name: Apple, Almond & Passionfruit Porridge
ingredients: 1 1⁄2 cups (150g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1 tbs honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
2 sprigs of fresh mint leaves picked
preparation: Combine oats, milk, cinnamon and salt in a saucepan, bring to a simmer and cook for about 10-15 minutes until creamy.
Divide porridge between bowls. Top with apple, passionfruit pulp, almonds, honey and mint to serve.

name: Banana & Peanut Butter Smoothie
ingredients: 1⁄3 cup rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1 1⁄2 tbs crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
2 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
1 tsp ground cinnamon reserve a little to serve
preparation: Blend all ingredients until smooth. Enjoy!

name: Apple & Cinnamon Pancakes
ingredients: 1 tbs maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1⁄3 cup (35g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
preparation: Heat half the oil in a non-stick skillet over low heat. Add apple, sprinkle with cinnamon and cook until translucent, about 12-15 minutes. Remove from skillet and set aside.

In a large mixing bowl combine flour, oats, cinnamon, baking powder and salt. In another bowl whisk milk, eggs, vanilla and lemon juice, stir through dry ingredients until almost fully incorporated. Stir through half the apple mixture

Heat non-stick skillet over medium-low heat, grease with remaining oil and pour 1⁄2 cupfuls of mixture into the skillet. Cook until bubbles appear on the surface and edges are cooked (1-2 minutes). Flip and cook for another 1-2 minutes.
Divide between plates and serve topped with the yogurt, remaining cooked apple and maple syrup.

name: Cinnamon Pancakes with Nectarines
ingredients: 2 nectarines, yellow or white sliced (or peaches or 1 cup of berries )
1 tbs maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
2⁄3 cup (80g) wholewheat spelt flour (or gluten free)
1⁄2 cup (60g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
preparation: Blend pancake ingredients until smooth and set aside.

Heat oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Use a 1⁄4 cup measure to pour batter into pan. Cook for 2 minutes until bubbles appear on top and pancake looks set, flip and cook for another minute. Set aside and repeat with remaining mixture.
Divide pancakes between plates, top with yogurt, sliced nectarine, drizzle with maple syrup and serve.

name: Tahini Granola with Stewed Pears
ingredients: 1 tbs (20ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
2⁄3 cup (65g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1⁄2 cup (60g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
1⁄2 cup (125g) Greek yogurt (or dairy-free alternative) to serve
preparation: Preheat oven to 300°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.

Place maple syrup, tahini and cinnamon in a large bowl and whisk to combine. Add almonds, coconut, oats and toss to coat. Spread on baking sheet and sprinkle over sesame seeds. Bake for 20 minutes, stirring halfway through, until golden. Cool completely on sheet to allow granola to crisp up.
Meanwhile, bring a small saucepan of water to a simmer. Add pears and gently poach for 10-15 minutes (depending on ripeness) until tender. Transfer to a plate to drain.
To serve, mix protein powder into yogurt and divide between serving bowls. Top with pear and granola to serve.

name: Chocolate Buttermilk Waffles
ingredients: 2 cups (270g) all-purpose flour (or gluten-free if required)
1⁄4 cup (60ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
150g 70% dark chocolate (or dairy-free alternative) finely chopped
70g fresh or frozen raspberries roughly mashed
1 tbs maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Preheat oven to 245°F.
Combine flour, cacao, maple, cacao nibs, baking powder, baking soda and salt in a large bowl and make a well in the centre.
Whisk egg yolks, buttermilk, oil and vanilla together and incorporate into dry ingredients, mixing until just combined.
Beat egg whites in a small bowl until soft peaks form and gently fold into batter. Fold in chocolate until just combined.
Preheat waffle iron to high heat and cook waffles in batches. Keep waffles warm in the oven on a wire rack whilst cooking the remainder.
Divide waffles between plates, top with berries and drizzle with maple syrup to serve.

name: Smoked Salmon & Asparagus Crepes
preparation: Blend all crepe ingredients together and allow to stand for 10 minutes.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat, toss asparagus with oil and cook for 3-5 minutes, until tender and charred. Remove from skillet and set aside.
Add 2-3 tbs batter to the heated skillet and cook for 1 minute on each side, repeat with remaining mixture.
Combine ricotta, lemon juice and chives together in a small bowl.
To assemble, spread equal portions of ricotta mix onto each crepe, top with ribbons of smoked salmon, asparagus and season with salt & pepper.

name: Warm Breakfast Greens Bowl
ingredients: 1⁄2 bunch of broccolini (5 1/2 oz bunch) stalks sliced lengthways
1⁄4 bunch of kale (14 oz bunch) stems removed & leaves roughly shredded
2 thin slices (1 1/2 oz ea) wholegrain bread (or gluten free) toasted
preparation: Bring a small saucepan of water to the boil, reduce to a gentle simmer and add vinegar.  Stir in a circular motion to create a vortex and gently slide eggs into the water and cook for 4 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon and pat dry.
Place pepitas in a medium non-stick skillet over medium heat, toast for 1-2 minutes, remove from pan and set aside.
Heat oil over medium heat, lightly brown garlic and chilli. Add greens and cook until wilted, season with salt and pepper.
Assemble greens and quinoa in a bowl, top with eggs and pepitas. Serve with toast on the side.

name: Savory Oatmeal with Prosciutto & Mushrooms
ingredients: 1 sprig of fresh thyme leaves picked
160g rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
preparation: Heat a non-stick saucepan over medium heat and cook shallot and prosciutto for 5 minutes until shallots are soft. Add the mushrooms, garlic and thyme and cook for a further 2 minutes. Add the oats and stock. Cook for 8 minutes, stirring until thickened and adjust seasoning. If too thick, you may need to add a little water.

Meanwhile, bring a small saucepan of water to the boil, reduce to a gentle simmer and add vinegar. Stir in a circular motion to create a vortex and gently slide eggs into the water and cook for 4 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon and pat dry.
To serve, divide the oats between bowls, top with eggs and season with salt and pepper.

name: Chocolate Blueberry Smoothie Bowl
ingredients: 3 tbs (30g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
preparation: Blend coconut water, banana, oats, cocoa, chia and half the blueberries in a blender until smooth. Transfer to a bowl or jar and refrigerate for a few hours or overnight.
Top with remaining blueberries, coconut, almonds and cacao nibs to serve.

name: Blueberry & Coconut Quinoa Porridge
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (90g) white quinoa (or other color) rinsed
2 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Place quinoa, water and vanilla in a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a simmer and cook for 12-15 minutes until tender.
Stir through coconut milk and cottage cheese and transfer to serving bowl.
Sprinkle with coconut flakes, blueberries and drizzle with honey to serve.

name: Vanilla & Raspberry Swirl Smoothie
ingredients: 1⁄3 cup (40g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
2 tbs rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
2 tsp crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
1 1⁄3 cups (330ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
preparation: Blend half the raspberries in a blender and set aside.
Add remaining ingredients to the blender, including the other half of the raspberries and blend until smooth.
Pour into serving glass and gently stir through raspberry mix to create a "swirl" effect.

name: Breakfast Fry Up
ingredients: 1 sprig of fresh thyme leaves stripped
2 thick slices (2 1/2 oz ea) sourdough bread (or gluten free) toasted
preparation: Heat  a non-stick skillet over medium heat, add tomatoes and bacon and cook, turning until bacon is crisp and tomatoes have softened.
Push both to the side and crack eggs into the pan. Sprinkle with thyme, season with salt and pepper and cook eggs to your liking.
Serve eggs with bacon, tomato and toast.

name: Breakfast Bruschetta
ingredients: 2 thick slices (2 1/2 oz ea) wholegrain bread (or gluten free) toasted
preparation: Bring a small saucepan of water to the boil, reduce to a gentle simmer and add vinegar. Stir in a circular motion to create a vortex and gently crack eggs into the water and cook for 4 minutes. Remove with slotted spoon, pat dry.
While eggs are cooking, combine tomato mix ingredients in a small bowl.
Spread ricotta on toast and top with arugula, tomato mix and eggs. Season with salt and pepper to serve.

name: Mango & Passionfruit Pancakes
ingredients: 2 tbs milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄4 cup (30g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
preparation: In a medium sized bowl whisk eggs and milk together. Add banana, quinoa flakes, protein powder, cinnamon and baking powder and combine well.
Heat a non-stick skillet, scoop 1⁄4 cup of mixture into pan, cook for 2 minutes on each side. Repeat with remaining mixture.
In a small bowl, combine yogurt, mango and passionfruit pulp together.
Serve pancakes topped with fruit/yoghurt mixture.

name: Creamy Coconut & Turmeric Smoothie
ingredients: 2 tbs (20g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
preparation: Combine all ingredients in a blender until smooth.
Pour into two glasses and dust with extra nutmeg.

name: Nutty Banana Toast
ingredients: 2 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
2 thin slices (1 1/2 oz ea) rye bread (or gluten free) toasted
preparation: Heat non-stick skillet, lightly toast hazelnuts for 1-2 minutes, tossing regularly, until slightly golden. Remove from heat.
Blend tahini and honey together with a little hot water, to drizzle
Spread toast with ricotta, top with banana and hazelnuts and drizzle over tahini/honey syrup to serve.

name: Coconut, Raspberry & Mango Breakfast Smoothie
preparation: Combine all ingredients except shredded coconut in a blender until smooth. Pour into a glass and top with shredded coconut to serve.

name: Creamy Green Smoothie
ingredients: 1 cup (250ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄2 cup rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1⁄4 cup (30g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
preparation: Blend all ingredients on high until smooth and creamy and serve.

name: Matcha Choc-Mint Smoothie
ingredients: 1 cup (250ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
2 tbs (20g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
2 tbs (20g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
2 sprigs of fresh mint leaves picked, plus extra to serve
preparation: Blend all ingredients until smooth. Enjoy.

name: Pancakes with Blueberry & Maple Compote
ingredients: 2 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
3⁄4 cup (100g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
preparation: For pancakes, place banana, flour, baking powder, protein powder, milk and vanilla in a blender and blend until smooth.

Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Use a 1⁄4 cup measure to pour pancakes into skillet. Cook for 2 minutes until bubbles appear on top and pancake looks set, flip and cook for a further 1 minute. Remove from skillet and repeat with remaining mixture.
To serve, divide pancakes between plates. Place a dollop of yogurt onto each stack and spoon over blueberry compote. Serve.

name: Crunchy Granola with Coconut & Berries
ingredients: 1 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1 1⁄2 tbs rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Preheat oven to 320°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Heat oil in a small saucepan over low heat. Add maple syrup and cinnamon and stir to combine.

Place oats, almonds, pecans and Brazil nuts in a large bowl. Add oil mixture and stir to coat. Spread onto prepared tray and roast for 10 minutes, then add the coconut and toss granola, then return to oven for another 10 minutes until golden and crunchy.
Set aside to cool completely.
To serve, place yogurt in a small bowl, top with granola, berries and maple syrup.

name: Mushroom, Egg & Avocado Stack
ingredients: 2 thin slices(1 1/2 oz ea) sourdough bread (or gluten free) toasted
preparation: Bring a small saucepan of water to the boil, reduce to a gentle simmer and add vinegar. Stir in a circular motion to create a vortex and gently crack eggs into the water, cook for 4 minutes. Remove with slotted spoon, pat dry.
Meanwhile heat oil in a non-stick skillet and add mushrooms, season and saute for 3 minutes. While cooking, combine avocado mix in a small bowl.
To assemble, place spinach on sourdough toast and top with avocado, mushrooms and eggs. Season to serve.

name: Peaches & Cream Spelt Crepes
ingredients: 2⁄3 cup (160ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
4 tbs (40g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
2 yellow peaches stone removed & thinly sliced
1 tbs (20ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Place flour, milk, egg and vanilla in a small bowl and whisk to combine.

Heat oil in a medium non-stick skillet over medium heat. Pour in a quarter of the batter and swirl skillet to coat evenly. Cook for 2 minutes until golden on the bottom. Flip and cook for a further minute on the other side. Transfer to a plate and repeat with remaining mixture.
Mix ricotta with protein powder and spread down the centre of each crepe.
Layer peach slices over the ricotta. Fold crepe over peaches, drizzle with maple syrup and serve sprinkled with almonds.

name: Kale & Zucchini Fritters with Salmon
ingredients: 1⁄3 cup (80ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄2 zucchini (medium) grated & squeezed of excess water
1⁄4 bunch of kale (14 oz bunch) thinly sliced, stalk removed
preparation: Whisk eggs and milk together in a medium sized bowl. Add zucchini, kale, buckwheat flour, salt and pepper. Combine well.
Heat oil in a non-stick skillet, spoon 1⁄3 cup of mixture into pan and flatten, cook for 2 minutes on each side. Repeat with remaining mixture.
Serve with yogurt, smoked salmon and top with chives.

name: Avocado Hummus Toast with Asparagus
ingredients: 1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
2 tsp hulled tahini at room temperature
4 sprigs of fresh cilantro plus extra to serve
4 thin slices (1 1/2 oz ea) wholegrain bread (or gluten free) toasted
preparation: Place avocado, chickpeas, lemon juice, tahini, cumin and cilantro in a small food processor and blend until smooth, adding a little water if too thick.

Heat a medium non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add asparagus and cook, turning, for 4-5 minutes until crisp-tender. Season with salt and pepper and transfer to a plate. Crack eggs into skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until cooked to your liking.
Spread toast slices with hummus, top with asparagus and eggs and season with salt and pepper to serve.

name: Spiced Chai Breakfast Bowl
ingredients: 1 1⁄4 cups (315ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1 tbs honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Heat milk, water and tea bags in a saucepan over medium heat until it comes to the boil. Remove bags, add quinoa, half the honey and reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer gently for 15 minutes, stirring regularly, until quinoa is cooked.
At the same time blend cottage cheese, yogurt and remaining honey until smooth. Stir through cooked quinoa.
Divide quinoa between bowls, top with banana, cacao nibs and a dust of cinnamon to serve.

name: Wholemeal Pancakes with Ricotta, Berries & Pistachios
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (70g) wholewheat spelt flour (or gluten free)
1 sprig of fresh mint leaves picked
1 tbs maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: In a large bowl whisk the egg whites for 2-3 minutes until frothy and set aside. In another bowl, mix together the egg yolks, almond milk, ricotta, flour, baking powder and salt until just combined, then fold through the whisked egg whites.
Heat oil in a non-stick frypan over medium-low heat. Use a 1⁄2 cup measure for each pancake and cook for 2 minutes a side until golden.
Divide pancakes between serving plates and spoon over yogurt, top with berries, pistachios, mint and drizzle with maple syrup.

name: Chocolate Espresso Smoothie
ingredients: 1 1⁄2 cups (360ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1 tsp instant coffee adjust depending on taste
1⁄2 cup rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1⁄3 cup (40g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
2 tsp raw cacao powder (or cocoa powder)
preparation: Dissolve coffee in the boiling water.
Blend all ingredients in a blender until smooth. Enjoy!

name: Simple Shakshuka
ingredients: 1⁄2 can of chopped tomatoes (14 oz can)
2 thin slices(1 1/2 oz ea) sourdough bread (or gluten free) toasted
preparation: Heat oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat, add garlic and spices, saute for 1 minute. Add tomatoes and bring to a simmer.
Create a well in the sauce for each egg and crack an egg in each space. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Reduce heat slightly, cover and allow to cook for 7 minutes (or until eggs are to your liking).
Remove from heat, gently add spinach around eggs and stir into sauce, to wilt slightly. Crumble feta on top, sprinkle with chilli and serve with toast.

name: Mango & Turmeric Smoothie
ingredients: 3⁄4 cup (190ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄3 cup (40g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
2 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
1⁄2 tsp ground turmeric plus extra for dusting
preparation: Place all ingredients in a blender and blend on high until smooth and creamy. Serve sprinkled with extra turmeric. Enjoy.

name: Archie's Buckwheat Pancakes
ingredients: 6 sprigs of fresh mint leaves stripped
1 1⁄3 tbs (40g) honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Spread hazelnuts in a single layer evenly over tray and roast for 10 minutes. Cool, chop finely and set aside.
Whisk together egg yolks, melted butter and buttermilk. Add flour, baking soda and salt and stir through. Gently fold hazelnuts through.
Whisk egg whites in a separate bowl until soft peaks form and gently fold into batter.

Heat oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add 1⁄4 cup of mixture at a time, cooking for 2 minutes or until bubbles appear on top, flip and cook for another minute. Remove from skillet, keep warm and repeat with remaining mixture.
Divide between plates, top with berries, extra hazelnuts and yogurt. Scatter over mint leaves and drizzle with honey to serve.

name: Spicy Tempeh Breakfast Burrito
ingredients: 2 sprigs of fresh cilantro roughly chopped
1 small (1 ½ oz) wholegrain/wholewheat wrap or tortilla (or gluten free)
preparation: In a small bowl, mix together onion, garlic, tomatoes, lime juice and jalapeno and season to taste.
Partially heat the tortillas in the skillet for a few seconds, remove from heat and top them with tempeh, tomato mix, avocado and fresh cilantro.

Fold the tortillas in half, and then half again and use your fingers to tuck in all the ingredients. Once tightly folded, add the tortilla to a skillet on high heat and warm until sides are browned and slightly crispy. Slice in half to serve.

name: Chocolate Avocado Smoothie
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (50g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
1⁄3 cup (35g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
preparation: Place all ingredients in a blender, and blend on high until smooth and creamy. Serve.

name: Choc Mint Smoothie Bowl
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (125ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
2 1⁄2 tsp raw cacao powder (or cocoa powder)
1⁄2 cup (20g) baby spinach leaves fresh or frozen
1⁄4 head of cauliflower (2 lb head) steamed then frozen overnight
1 sprig of fresh mint leaves picked
preparation: Blend all smoothie ingredients in a blender until smooth. Adjust to desired consistency using water, if required.
Pour into bowl and arrange toppings.

name: Nutty White Bean Toast with Tofu
ingredients: 1 can of cannellini beans (14 oz can) rinsed & drained
4 thin slices (1 1/2 oz ea) wholegrain bread (or gluten free) toasted
preparation: Place cashews and almonds in food processor, pulse until nuts are broken and coarse. Add beans, lemon juice, oil and salt, pulse until combined but still chunky.
Heat non-stick skillet, fry crumbled tofu for 2-3 minutes.
Divide bean mix between toast, top with tofu and parsley.

name: Almond, Date & Banana Smoothie
ingredients: 2 pitted medjool dates pre-soaked in boiling water
1⁄3 cup (30g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1⁄4 cup (30g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
preparation: Combine all ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth.

name: Chocolate & Raspberry Pancakes
ingredients: 2 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: To make pancake mix, combine mashed banana, flour, cocoa, baking powder, protein powder, milk and vanilla unitl just combined. Don't overmix, you’ll activate the gluten and they will become rubbery.

Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Use a 1⁄4 cup measure to pour pancakes into pan. Cook for 2 minutes until bubbles appear on top and pancake looks set. Flip and cook for a further 1 minute. Remove from skillet and repeat with remaining mixture.
Meanwhile, mix maple syrup, coconut oil and cocoa together in a small bowl until smooth.
Divide pancakes between plates. Add yogurt, drizzle over chocolate sauce and  top with raspberries to serve.

name: Herb-Fried Eggs with Avocado & Sauerkraut
ingredients: olive oil or ghee if you prefer
1 thick slice (2 1/2 oz) sourdough bread (or gluten free)
preparation: In a non-stick skillet, heat oil over medium heat, add half the herbs and cook for a minute or so. Carefully crack eggs onto the herbs and continue to cook to your liking. At the same time toast bread on the other side of the pan.
Drizzle lemon juice over avocado, season and scatter over sesame seeds.
Serve eggs on toast with avocado, sauerkraut, remaining herbs and season to taste with lemon juice and salt.

name: Breakfast Congee with Tempeh
ingredients: 1⁄3 bunch of (60g) asparagus sliced on the angle
1 tbs (20ml) soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
1⁄4 bunch of bok choy (buk, pak or puk choy)(14 oz bunch) sliced
1⁄4 bunch of fresh flat leaf parsley (5 oz bunch) chopped
1 tsp soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
preparation: In a medium saucepan add stock, rice, half the ginger and half the scallions and bring to the boil. Reduce to a simmer and cook for 30 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and rice is cooked.
Heat olive oil in non-stick skillet and saute remaining ginger, scallions and garlic. Add tempeh, asparagus and soy sauce and cook for 5 minutes.
To make dressing, blend all ingredients in a food processor until smooth, adjust seasoning and set aside.
Once rice is cooked, stir through bok choy and divide between bowls. Top with tempeh and asparagus and drizzle over dressing to serve.

name: Breakfast Oat Pizza With Artichoke & Havarti
ingredients: 1 cup (100g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
preparation: Preheat oven to 375°F.
