Mix the oats and half the eggs in a small bowl and season with salt and pepper and set aside.
In another bowl, combine the artichoke, broccoli and spinach. Mix well and set aside.
Heat a skillet over medium-high heat and add half of the oil. Add the oat mixture and spread thinly to shape into a round pizza base. Cook for 1 minute on each side, then remove from the pan.
Spread base with tomato sauce. Spread half the shredded cheese over, followed by the mixed vegetables. Finish with the remaining cheese, then sprinkle with the oregano.

Crack the remaining eggs onto the pizza. Season with salt and drizzle with the remaining olive oil and bake for 6 minutes, or until the cheese is melting and the eggs are opaque but not overcooked. Cut into slices and enjoy.

name: Peanut Butter & Banana Pancakes
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (70g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
2 tsp crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
1 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Place pancake ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth.

Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Use a 1⁄4 cup measure to pour pancakes into skillet. Cook for 2 minutes until bubbles appear on top and pancake looks set, flip and cook for a further 1 minute. Remove from skillet and repeat with remaining mixture.
Meanwhile, place peanut butter in a small bowl and microwave for 20 seconds to soften.
Divide pancakes between plates, top with remaining sliced banana and drizzle over maple syrup and peanut butter to serve.

name: Banana Nut Pancakes
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (50g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup) to serve
preparation: Place half the bananas, all the oats, cottage cheese, baking powder, egg and milk in a blender and blend until smooth.

Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add 1⁄4 cup of mixture at a time, cooking for 2 minutes or until bubbles appear on top, flip and cook for another minute. Remove from skillet, keep warm and repeat with remaining mixture. Divide pancakes between serving plates.
Slice remaining banana, add to pancakes, drizzle over honey and sprinkle with almonds to serve.

name: Kimchi, Eggs & Avocado Toast
ingredients: 2 thick slices (2 1/2 oz ea) wholegrain bread (or gluten free) toasted
preparation: Place eggs in a saucepan of cold water and bring to a rolling boil. Continue to simmer for 5  minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon and place in a sink of cold water to cool. Peel and slice.
Place spinach on toast and top with avocado, kimchi and eggs.

name: Pineapple, Coconut & Turmeric Smoothie
ingredients: 2⁄3 cup (60g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
preparation: Combine all ingredients in a blender until smooth. Enjoy!

name: Buckwheat Waffles with Balsamic Strawberries & Ricotta
ingredients: 1 tbs (30g) honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup) warmed
1 tbs (20ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Whisk honey and balsamic vinegar together and gently toss with strawberries. Set aside at room temperature.
Preheat a waffle iron, or alternatively this mix can also be made into pancakes.

Place the flour, baking powder and baking soda in a medium bowl and whisk to combine. Add buttermilk, egg and maple syrup and whisk again until combined. Pour mixture into waffle iron using 1⁄2 a cup measures for each waffle. Cook for 4-5 minutes until golden.
Top warm waffles with ricotta and strawberries to serve.
NOTE: Leftover waffles can be frozen for 3 months then reheated for 2 minutes in a toaster.

name: Chilli Mushroom & Eggs Toast
ingredients: 1 tsp white vinegar for poaching eggs
2 thin slices(1 1/2 oz ea) sourdough bread (or gluten free) toasted
preparation: Bring a small saucepan of water to the boil, reduce to a gentle simmer and add vinegar. Stir in a circular motion to create a vortex,  and gently slide eggs into the water and cook for 4 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon, pat dry.
Heat oil in a non-stick skillet. Add spinach, garlic, mushrooms, chilli flakes, parsley, salt and pepper. Saute for 2-3 minutes or until tender.
Assemble mushrooms on toast and top with parmesan and eggs.

name: Raspberry Coconut Smoothie
ingredients: 1⁄3 cup (40g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
2 tbs rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
preparation: Blend all ingredients in a blender until smooth. Enjoy!

name: Banana & Chia Smoothie
ingredients: 1⁄4 cup (30g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
1⁄3 cup (30g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1 tbs (20g) crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
preparation: Combine all ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth.

name: Ricotta Omelette with Garlic Tomatoes
ingredients: 2 thick slices (2 1/2 oz ea) sourdough bread (or gluten free) toasted
preparation: Whisk eggs in a small bowl. Heat non-stick skillet and pour eggs into pan. Allow to cook for 30 seconds.
Add ricotta and spinach on one side of eggs, allow to cook for 1 minute.
Fold egg over ricotta and spinach and cook for a further 1-2 minutes or until egg is cooked and ricotta is slightly melted. Transfer to a plate.
In same hot skillet, saute garlic and tomatoes for 2 minutes and serve on top of omelette. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve with toast.

name: Coconut Chia Pudding with Mango
ingredients: 1 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Place yogurt, coconut water, chia and maple syrup in a bowl and whisk to combine. Cover and refrigerate for 20 minutes, or overnight, until set.
Place almonds and coconut in a small dry skillet over low heat and toss for 1-2 minutes until golden. Set aside to cool.
Top pudding with banana, mango, passionfruit pulp, toasted almonds and coconut flakes to serve.

name: Spiced Apple Pie Chia Pudding
ingredients: 1⁄4 tsp ground cinnamon plus extra for dusting
preparation: Place the apple, almonds, mixed spice, cinnamon, yogurt, chia seeds and milk in a medium bowl and whisk to combine.
Divide between glasses or small bowls, cover and refrigerate for 20 minutes or overnight. Divide granola over the top, dust with cinnamon to serve.

name: Scrambled Chickpeas on Toast
ingredients: 1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained, reserve 1 tbs liquid
1 tsp Moroccan spice mix (or Ras el hanout-a mixture of cumin, coriander, paprika, ginger, turmeric)
4 thin slices(1 1/2 oz ea) sourdough bread (or gluten free) toasted
1 small red chilli pepper thinly sliced
preparation: Place chickpeas and nutritional yeast in a small bowl and mash with a fork, leaving some chickpeas whole. Add chickpea water and spice and stir to combine.

Heat oil in small non-stick skillet over medium heat. Cook garlic for 1 minute, taking care not to let it brown. Add chickpea mixture and cook, stirring, for 3 minutes until fragrant and heated through. Add spinach and cook for a further 1 minute until wilted.
Divide chickpea mixture between slices of toast. Top with sliced avocado, season with salt and pepper and sprinkle with chilli.

name: Breakfast Scramble on Sweet Potato Toast
ingredients: 500g sweet potatoes washed & cut into 1/2 inch slices lengthways
1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) rinsed & drained
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a baking tray with baking paper.
Place sweet potato on prepared tray and coat with olive oil. Season with salt and pepper and roast for 20-25 minutes until golden and tender.

Meanwhile, place chickpeas, tofu and yeast in a small bowl and mash. Season with salt and pepper and stir through lemon juice. Spread chickpeas on cooked sweet potato and top with sliced avocado. Top with cilantro leaves and chilli flakes to serve.

name: Coconut Green Smoothie
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (50g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
preparation: Place all ingredients in a blender and blend on high until smooth. Enjoy!

name: Peanut Butter & Jelly Oatmeal
ingredients: 3⁄4 cup (75g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1 tbs crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
preparation: Place oats, milk, yogurt and vanilla in a bowl and stir to combine. Cover and refrigerate for a minimum of 30 minutes (or overnight for a creamy grab-and-go breakfast).
Place raspberries in a small bowl and mash with a fork. Add maple syrup and chia seeds and stir to combine. Set aside for 5 minutes.
Combine peanut butter and hot water in a small bowl. Drizzle over oats and top with raspberries to serve.

name: Kimchi Savory Oatmeal
ingredients: 2⁄3 cup (60g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1⁄4 bunch of kale (14 oz bunch) chopped
preparation: Place oats in saucepan with vegetable stock and broccoli. Bring to boil and simmer covered for 7 minutes. Add water if more liquid preferred. Add kale in final minute of cooking.

In another small saucepan, bring small amount of water to the boil, reduce to gentle simmer and add vinegar. Stir in a circular motion to create a vortex and gently slide cracked eggs into the water and cook for 4 minutes. Remove with slotted spoon, pat dry.
Serve porridge in a bowl, top with kimchi, eggs, sliced avocado and season with salt and pepper.

name: Sweet Potato, Kale & Tofu Scramble
ingredients: 1⁄2 bunch of kale (14 oz bunch) roughly chopped
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F. Line baking sheet with baking paper.
Toss sweet potato, oil, cinnamon, salt and pepper in a bowl. Scatter over baking tray and roast for 20 minutes.
While potato is cooking prepare tofu. Heat oil in non-stick frypan, add garlic and curry powder. Crumble tofu into pan with fingers, season with salt and pepper and gently mix.
Allow tofu to cook for 5 minutes, before gently stirring. Add some water if too dry. Add kale and toss to combine until kale has wilted slightly.
Serve with sweet potato and lemon wedge.

name: Prosciutto & Egg Open Crepes
preparation: Blend all crepe ingredients together and allow to sit for 30 minutes.
Heat non-stick skillet, add 2-3 tbs crepe batter to skillet and cook for 1 minute on each side, repeat with remaining mixture.

Cook prosciutto in skillet for 2 minutes or until slightly crispy and set aside. Slide cracked eggs individually into skillet (2 at a time depending on skillet size), cook for 3 minutes or longer for harder eggs, repeat with remaining eggs.

To assemble crepes, place crepe in skillet on low heat and top with 1⁄4 of spinach, cheese, prosciutto and 1 egg. Fold 4 sides to the middle creating a square allowing to heat for a minute. Repeat with remaining mixture.
Note: Store leftover crepes in airtight container.

name: Coconut & Raspberry Ripple Oats
ingredients: 3⁄4 cup (75g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1 tbs honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Place the oats, cottage cheese, chia seeds, coconut milk and vanilla in a blender and blend on high until smooth. Pour into glasses, cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes (or overnight).
Place the raspberries and honey in a blender and blend on high until smooth. Divide the raspberry mixture between glasses and use a knife to ripple through the oats. Top with coconut flakes to serve.

name: Berrylicious Ricotta Pancakes
ingredients: 2 1⁄2 tbs (50ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1⁄3 cup (100g) almond butter (or other nut butter)
2 cups (200g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free) half blitzed
preparation: To make the berry compote, heat berries in a saucepan with maple syrup and bring to boil. Once berries are bursting add lemon juice and salt, remove from heat. Set aside.
Whisk almond butter and boiling water together until smooth. Set aside.
Combine blitzed oats with remaining oats and bi-carb soda in a large bowl.
In a small bowl whisk egg yolks, ricotta, vanilla and almond milk. Stir in banana.
In a separate bowl beat egg whites with electric mixer until soft peaks form. Add yolk mixture to dry ingredients and combine well. Fold in egg whites until well combined.
Heat non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add 1⁄4 of the mixture to pan and cook for 3 minutes each side. Keep warm and repeat with remaining mixture.
Serve pancakes, topped with blueberries and almond drizzle.

name: Coconut Rice Porridge
ingredients: 3⁄4 cup (150g) black rice cover in water and soak for 1-8 hours
2 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Place rice, coconut milk, salt, vanilla, maple syrup and water in a pot and bring to boil, reduce to a simmer and cook covered for 30 minutes. Stir frequently until rice is tender. (Time varies depending on length of time rice is soaked).
Top with fruits, slivered almonds and yogurt to serve.

name: Creamy Strawberry Smoothie
ingredients: 1⁄3 cup (40g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
1⁄3 cup (40g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Blend all ingredients in a blender until smooth, adding a little more water if necessary. Pour into glass and serve. Enjoy.

name: Smashed Avocado with Fried Egg & Dukkah
ingredients: 1⁄4 bunch of kale (14 oz bunch) leaves chopped
2 thin slices(1 1/2 oz ea) sourdough bread (or gluten free) toasted
1 tsp dukkah (a mix of chopped almonds, sesame seeds & ground cumin)
preparation: Heat oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Cook garlic for 1 minute until fragrant, add kale and cook, stirring for 1-2 minutes until just wilted.
In the same skillet, fry eggs for 2 minutes or until cooked to your liking.
Spread toast with avocado, top with kale, eggs, dukkah and fresh chilli. Season with salt and pepper to serve.

name: Veggie & Tofu Breakfast Hash
ingredients: 1⁄4 bunch of kale (14 oz bunch) leaves chopped
1 thick slice (2 1/2 oz) sourdough bread (or gluten free) toasted
preparation: Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and toss almonds for 3-4 minutes until toasted, set aside.

Add cauliflower, sweet potato and cumin to skillet, season with salt and pepper and stir to combine. Cover and cook for 5-8 minutes, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are tender. Add kale and stir until just wilted. Transfer to a plate and cover with foil to keep warm.

Place the same skillet over medium-high heat and cook tofu for 3 minutes. Scatter over sesame seeds, stirring until tofu is golden. Return vegetables to pan and heat through. Adjust seasoning, top with almonds and serve with toast.

name: Sweet Potato Hash Browns
ingredients: 1⁄4 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) chopped
preparation: In a large bowl, mix together sweet potato, tofu, scallion, cilantro, cornstarch, cumin and salt and pepper until well combined. Form into 8 patties.
Heat oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Cook patties for 3-4 minutes a side, pressing down with a spatula as they cook, until cooked and golden on both sides.
Divide hash browns between plates and serve with hummus and baby spinach.
Leftover hash browns can be stored covered in the refrigerator for 3 days. Reheat in oven on 355°F for 5-10 minutes until crisp and hot.

name: Bacon, Egg & Avocado Stack
ingredients: 2 thick slices (2 1/2 oz ea) sourdough bread (or gluten free) toasted
preparation: Bring a small saucepan of water to the boil, reduce to gentle simmer and add vinegar. Stir in a circular motion to create a vortex and gently crack eggs into the water and cook for 4 minutes. Remove eggs with slotted spoon and pat dry.
While waiting for water to boil, heat non-stick skillet over medium heat and cook bacon for 2 minutes on each side.
While eggs are cooking, combine avocado mix ingredients in a small bowl.
To assemble, place spinach on sourdough toast and top with avocado, bacon and eggs. Season to serve.
